items.title: Anker’s sleek 240W 8-in-1 charging station with app control returns to its lowest price at 30% off
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing Valentine’s day sale, Anker’s official Amazon storefront is offering its 240W 8-in-1 Prime charging station for $89.99 shipped. This is originally a $165 unit that has more recently been fetching close to $130. It dropped to $90 first the time during last year’s fall Prime Day sale – which it also hit during the Black Friday sale – and today’s deal marks the return of that with a 30% discount. This is the lowest price we’ve tracked for this model, which comes loaded with standout features that make it a dependable charging solution, and you can learn more about it below.

items.title: Exclusive hands-on with Nintendo’s new My Mario collection
items.summary:
Nintendo has just launched its My Mario collection in the US, which was originally introduced in Japan. The My Mario product line has been designed as an easy introduction to the Mario world for very young kids through toys, apparel, books, and simple digital experiences. I was able to get an exclusive hands-on with the entire product line and was even able to bring my four-year-old daughter to see what she thought of these new toys. The My Mario line was built around letting parents and kids explore and play together using iconic characters like Mario, Luigi, Peach, and so many more. Here is what you should know.

items.summary:
GOOLOO F3 Compressed Air Duster

Buy for $30 (Reg. $50)

What we love

Dust collects, whether we want it to or not, and rather than use some bulky means to blow it all away, you can get far more versatility with this lightweight GOOLOO air duster. It’s great for cleaning out PCs and peripherals, home furniture, car crevices, and even outdoor gear thanks to the included attachments – plus, the integrated 5,000mAh battery allows for up to 4 hours of runtime across its three modes.

items.title: New low knocks 8BitDo’s officially licensed Xbox all-button arcade controller down to $60 (40% off)
items.summary:
As part of its now live video game sale, Woot is offering the officially licensed Xbox variant of 8BitDo’s All-Button Arcade Controller for $59.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This particular variant of the controller is compatible with Xbox Series X|S and Windows PCs, and it typically goes for $100 at Amazon, where it’s sold out right now. Today’s deal delivers a 40% markdown, shaving $40 off its usual going rate. This unit dropped to $70 earlier this month as part of Woot’s previous video game sale, but today’s updated offer knocks it $10 below that to mark the lowest price we have tracked for it. The standard variant compatible with Switch 2 is also down to $59.99 Prime shipped, which is within $3 of its all-time low.

Buy for $20 (Reg. $30)

These sorts of wallets can get pretty pricey if you look towards those brands you probably see advertising all over YouTube and the like, but Lamicall is delivering a nearly identical design for a fraction of the price here. Joining the aerospace-grade aluminum and carbon fiber build, this one features a hinge design (as opposed to just some elastic) to keep tings thin and streamlined when you don’t have as many cards, but is also ready to accommodate as many as 20 alongside a strap/clip for cash.

items.title: Save $80 while scoring the 6.9-pound 256Wh Jackery Explorer 240D power station at its second-lowest $139 rate
items.summary:
Through the official Jackery Amazon storefront, you can currently pick up the Explorer 240D Portable Power Station that is down at $138.99 shipped, which not only beats out the direct website pricing by $80, but also has several discounted bundle options on the same Amazon landing page. Down from its $209 full price, since December, it’s regularly been keeping to this same rate, with only a few spikes back up to its full rate in that timeframe. We don’t normally see this model discounted directly from the brand’s site, with Amazon instead giving you the chance to pick it up at the second-lowest price we have tracked – just $7 above the one-time low that hasn’t reappeared since Black Friday.

items.title: Just $5 today gets you this USB-C iPad stylus that looks like an Apple Pencil (80% off)
items.summary:
Apple Pencil alternative for iPad

Buy for $5 (Reg. $25)

Enter promo code 4HDLNIEI for $20 off.

What we love

It may not deliver all the advanced features of the official Apple Pencil, but this budget-friendly stylus covers the basics and then some. You still get useful features such as palm rejection and USB-C charging. It magnetically snaps onto select iPad Pro and iPad Air models as well, and it even looks like one at a bargain. It doesn’t get much less than this if you’re looking for an Apple Pencil alternative to pair with your iPad and try a stylus for the first time.
